data.title: Renvyle House Hotel & Resort, Connemara, Co. Galway, H91 X8Y8
data.meta_description: | Renvyle House Hotel & Resort | Connemara, Co. Galway, H91 X8Y8, Ireland
data.text:
About Us

A FAMILY OWNED AND OPERTATED, 4* HOTEL WITH A STUNNING LOCATION AND PROVIDING AWARD WINNING FOOD, SERVICE AND HOSPITALITY. A LONG AND VARIED HISTORY AND RENOWNED FOR ITS FOOD AND HOSPITALITY. RENVYLE HOUSE HOTEL AWAITS BEING DISCOVERED BY YOU.

HERE, THE ONLY STRESS IS ON RELAXATION.

Renvyle house is a historic country house hotel, situated in the wild splendour of Connemara on the shores of the Wild Atlantic Way.

The hotel is located on a 150 acre estate which include a private lake, 1km of beach on the shores of the Atlantic, woodlands and gardens. Over several centuries, Renvyle House has been built, pulled down, rebuilt, burned to ashes and rebuilt once again. A Chieftain of one of the oldest and most powerful Gaelic clans in Connacht once lived here. It was also the home of poet, statesman and surgeon Oliver St. John Gogarty (Buck Mulligan Of James Joyce's "Ulysses") and, since becoming a country house hotel in 1883, Renvyle House has played host to many famous people - Augustus John, Lady Gregory, Yeats and Churchill among them.

Leisure facilities include fly-fishing, boating, tennis, sea swimming, shore angling, lawn bowls, croquet, an outdoor heated pool and clay pigeon shooting are just some of the options that you will find at Renvyle House Hotel. It is still a family owned and operated hotel being in the Coyle family since 1952.
